title: I can't even play anymore D:

embed.description: Dropbox is a free service that lets you bring your photos, docs, and videos anywhere and share them easily. Never email yourself a file again!

body:
I play League of Legends almost everyday without a problem, and I woke up this morning to play yet again! 
I clicked the launcher... and the LoL icon popped up.
The problem is, it never leaves. The game never launches :(
 I have researched and tried fixes on the internet, but they do not work!
I could really use help with this. I am on a mac, and the log can be viewed with the link. 
I am pretty sure this is the log where the error is occuring, because I had a log through all of the log files and this is the only one that has been modified today.
Please help, I'm crying {{item:3070}} 

Edit. 
After a while, an error window comes up saying 'Unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information.' At this point I am forced to click okay, and the popup closes.
I have also found that my sister, who is on the same wifi network, has the same problem.
I suspect that this problem may have something to do with the firewall, and I'm not sure how to check.

Edit 2. 
***Its been fixed! *** Thanks to rxdicalaliviyaah and Horse of Force....

Omg thank you so much!
> [{quoted}](name=rxdicalaliviyaah,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=fzsA6KJO,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-14T06:02:59.395+0000)
>
> Oh! That's great then, so am I actually, 10.10.1 (: The solution IS for a macbook, there's just two versions and I thought that you had a windows and it would work out fine anyway. 
> 
> System preferences>network>advanced>DNS: press the '+' button on the left side (DNS Servers), type 8.8.4.4, '+' button on the right side (Search domains), type 8.8.8.8. OK and apply. 
> 
> This WAS written at the bottom of the link I sent you, but I'm not sure if you got it? Since you did have a ":(" 
> 
> Well, try that and see if it works. Good luck! It worked for me. Tell me if it does or doesn't work (:



Thank you in advance!
{{champion:110}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:421}} {{champion:13}}

replies.body: Before reading the log I'd just like to clarify some things. When you open League and the icon "pops" up, do you actually get any prompts saying that there was an "error" of sorts? Does League automatically force close itself? Have you waited more than five minutes on it to make sure it wasn't just fixing the patcher?
Yes it does, a window comes up saying 'Unspecified error occurred. Please check the logs for more information.' At this point I am forced to click okay, and the popup closes.

Ok, so there is definitely something wrong.

You've tried changing your DNS to Google's public one, yes? Did that work? Did it change the result in any way?
Tysm!

Just a heads up with it, if you find another program aside from League having problems connecting to the internet, remember to set your DNS address back to what it was.

It shouldn't happen though, Google's DNS is pretty great. And thank you for the mention.

Happy gaming!

> [{quoted}](name=SuperAthleteRox,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=fzsA6KJO,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2015-01-14T09:28:43.667+0000)
>
> Tysm!

DOES IT WORK!!?!?!?!??!? XD

EDIT: 
Yep I see it did (: The solution took me about 5 hours to find XD caused me heaps of pain, glad to know you're back on too. 
Happy Gaming!

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=fzsA6KJO,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-14T06:47:43.636+0000)
>
> Ok, so there is definitely something wrong.
> 
> You've tried changing your DNS to Google's public one, yes? Did that work? Did it change the result in any way?

I don't think you need to do that. I myself posted a thread on this, but I found a solution and there was no longer a problem. 
I've already posted the solution on this page, and it should honestly work because he uses a Mac 10.10 

There was someone on my thread who had the same laptop and problem as me, I sent him the solution, and after five days of being unable to play LoL he said it was open and patching (he was just too lazy to try it before). Therefore, it's pretty legit.

Yeah, though it won't work for *everyone*.

On an unrelated note, my game is not working now.

Don't you **dare** suggest changing DNS.

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=fzsA6KJO,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-16T02:48:54.826+0000)
>
> Yeah, though it won't work for *everyone*.
> 
> On an unrelated note, my game is not working now.
> 
> Don't you **dare** suggest changing DNS.

So your game isn't working again? 
I guess changing the DNS won't fix everyone's problems, but can I ask if you're Windows or Mac? 
Anyway, good luck I guess, because my game is completely fixed and you'll probably find a way to get back onto yours anyway (:

>again?

first time

Anyway, I'm on Windows. Right now I'm trying literally everything, I'll post what works.

This worked for me too... Changing the DNS..

However, I found this weird, It was working perfectly fine yesterday, and today when i tried to launch the LoLPatcher, I just kept on getting the error. I made absolutely no changes to any of my Mac settings between yesterday and today.

And my friend who's using windows machine beside me is playing perfeectly fine exactly the same time as to when I was having issue.

So I am just wondering if this has something to do with Riot Servers since I was not the only person who got this issue ?

Thanks for posting the workaround tho... Appreciate it !!

> [{quoted}](name=gmeno,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=fzsA6KJO,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-01-14T11:34:03.261+0000)
>
> This worked for me too... Changing the DNS..
> 
> However, I found this weird, It was working perfectly fine yesterday, and today when i tried to launch the LoLPatcher, I just kept on getting the error. I made absolutely no changes to any of my Mac settings between yesterday and today.
> 
> And my friend who's using windows machine beside me is playing perfeectly fine exactly the same time as to when I was having issue.
> 
> So I am just wondering if this has something to do with Riot Servers since I was not the only person who got this issue ?
> 
> Thanks for posting the workaround tho... Appreciate it !!

Yeah, I just woke up yesterday and it was like that. This may have something to do with TPG actually, do you use it? I'm trying to figure out what happened.
 And you're welcome for the solution :D
AHHH WAIT! I may have found a suitable solution (: at least, I followed it and it worked, my LoL is now opening and patching at 37%. It's as simple as changing your dns, are you interested??
Yes of course! I am very interested!!

You use windows I presume? 
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/53Af63zR-unspecified-error-occurred-please-check-the-logs-for-more-information 
Solution on the bottom, you'll find it (: 
IT WORKS! Took me a while to patch, but I launched and just played a game! 
Let me know if it works for you (:
No, I'm actually running on OSX Yosemite, 10.10. :( Thanks :)

Oh! That's great then, so am I actually, 10.10.1 (: The solution IS for a macbook, there's just two versions and I thought that you had a windows and it would work out fine anyway. 

System preferences>network>advanced>DNS: press the '+' button on the left side (DNS Servers), type 8.8.4.4, '+' button on the right side (Search domains), type 8.8.8.8. OK and apply. 

This WAS written at the bottom of the link I sent you, but I'm not sure if you got it? Since you did have a ":(" 

Well, try that and see if it works. Good luck! It worked for me. Tell me if it does or doesn't work (:
Omg thank you so much!
It probably is the firewall in that case!!

My problem wasn't the firewall and I'm sure yours isn't too. I sent you my solution above, but if you want to make sure it's system preferences>security & privacy> firewall. From there, you can check if it's turned on. If it is, turn it off, but it most likely won't be 

Good luck again!
